title: Bluel
subtitle: Dynamic web page for a Photographer.
description: The project aimed to create a portfolio for an interior architect and make it dynamic by using vanilla JavaScript. The portfolio was connected to a REST API, which allowed access to real-time data. To ensure security, it was possible to log in securely using a JWT. The portfolio was also interactive, with the ability to add or delete works using a modal. This feature was only available to logged-in users to preserve site security. In summary, the project involved creating an online portfolio for an interior architect while integrating dynamic and interactive features. Using JavaScript and a REST API, the site was user-friendly and provided an enjoyable user experience.

title: Grimoire
subtitle: Backend of a book review website.
description: The project involved creating the backend of a website called Mon Vieux-Grimoire which allowed users to rate books among themselves. The backend was developed using Node.js and Express.js to create a REST API, which enabled users to perform CRUD operations on books.To ensure the security of the site, users were able to create an account and securely log in using JWT (JSON Web Token) and Helmet. Finally, to store the site's data, a NoSQL MongoDB database was used with the Mongoose framework. In summary, the project aimed to create a secure REST API for users to interact with the MongoDB database, allowing them to perform CRUD operations on books.

title: Carducci
subtitle: Debug and optimize a photographer's website.
description: The project involved optimizing Nina Carducci's website by globally optimizing the site, both in terms of performance and SEO. This optimization included implementing local SEO using Schema.org, adding metadata for social media, making accessibility-related modifications to the site, and producing an optimization report that presented all actions taken and their impact. The global optimization of the site involved improving performance in terms of page loading speed and user experience. With regards to SEO, the local SEO strategy based on Schema.org was implemented to optimize Nina Carducci's visibility on local search results. The addition of metadata for social media facilitated content sharing on these platforms, which improved audience reach and engagement. Accessibility-related modifications ensured that the site was accessible to all users, including those with disabilities or physical limitations. This may have included adding tags and attributes for screen readers, improving text readability, and implementing simplified navigation options. Finally, an optimization report was produced to present all actions taken and their impact. This report allowed Nina Carducci to monitor and evaluate the improvements made to the website.

title: Kasa
subtitle: Real estate rental web application.
description: The project involved creating the interface for Kasa, a website for peer-to-peer apartment rentals. To accomplish this, we chose to use the ReactJS JavaScript library to build a responsive and dynamic website. We also utilized reusable components to simplify the development and maintenance of the site. Kasa's interface was equipped with the React Router library, which made it easy to manage navigation between the various pages of the site. To store the information required for the proper functioning of the interface, we used JSON files. These files contained data related to the apartments offered for rent, as well as all the necessary information for booking, such as prices and availability. Thanks to the use of ReactJS, we were able to create a fast, smooth, and user-friendly interface for visitors to the site. The site's structure was designed to provide a pleasant and intuitive user experience, with search and filtering features to help users find an apartment based on their criteria. In summary, our project resulted in the creation of a functional, fast, user-friendly, and ergonomic website for Kasa, which allows users to easily find apartments for rent from peer-to-peer rental listings.
